column6:
\\〈Ganda〉\n
{So, how are the Poms doing, [lulu]?}\p

{I'm here to give you my <Report>.\n
Read this...}\p
column7:
these are used for some kind of Community report system that I haven't seen in the Yukkuri's playthrough. These cells seem to be for the intro and outro, the commentary itself is near the bottom of the file
-- note: i am not at all convinced this system is actually used. while there is code for the whole thing, i can't find any actual in-game trigger (there is a function which would trigger it that is not referenced at all). this event can be induced to occur by going to the community and setting memory value 0x801260E0 to 0x13, but the result is full of display errors and corrupts the community (permanently deleting all buildings). this could be because it's not being accessed correctly... or it may simply be an abandoned feature that doesn't work right. but i guess i'll make sure it "works" in the translation (in the broken state in which i'm able to test it), just in case.
...or maybe i won't, i really can't believe this is actually somehow used

column5: \p

〈ガンダ〉\n
「この　ひろい地を\n
　おまえに　あずける。\p

「ここを　じゆうに使って\n
　つかまえたポムを\n
　育てていくが良い。\p

「やがてポムたちは\n
　ここで、じぶんたちの\n
　せいかつを　することぢゃろう。\p

「そうやって、おまえは\n
　ポムがムムに　ならないように\n
　飼い育てていくのぢゃ。\p

「きっと、ポムにも　なにかワケが\n
　あるはずぢゃ。でも　いまは\n
　飼いならすしか方法はない。\p

「―ーそれからの[lulu]。\n
　ポムには〈えさ〉を\n
　あたえなきゃならん。\p

「ポムを　さがすことも\n
　だいじぢゃが\n
　〈えさ〉を　さがすことも―ー\p

「また　だいじなことぢゃ。\n
　ポムは大喰らいぢゃから\n
　〈えさ〉が　たくさん―ー\p

「ひつように　なるぞ！\p

「それと、ポムはいろんな能力を\n
　もっとるらしい‥‥。\p

「ときにはポムの力が\n
　ひつようになる、かもしれん。\p

「ぢゃから、そのときのためにも\n
　しっかりポムを育てるのぢゃ！\p

「ワシから　いえることは\n
　それぐらいぢゃの‥‥。\p

「―ー[lulu]。すくないが\n
　この　お金で、なにか\n
　ひつような物を買うが良い。\p
column6:
〈Ganda〉\n
{These lands are all yours.}\p

{Here you'll be able to raise every Pom you catch. Use this place however you like!}\p

{Before long, this will become a paradise for Poms... A place they can call home.}\p

{That way, they'll never turn into Mooms again!}\p

{There has to be a reason this is happening... But for now, the best we can do is make sure they're happy.}\p

{Oh, yes... Listen well, [lulu]. Poms require <food>!}\p

{While looking for Poms is important, finding <food> for them is equally important.}\p

{Poms are [em]big[/em] eaters, so you need a [em]lot[/em] of food!}\p

{Also, it seems that Poms possess special powers.}\p

{There may be times when their powers are necessary to progress.}\p

{That's why you must raise them properly!}\p

{That is all I can say...}\p

{Take this, [lulu]. It's not much, but use this money to buy whatever you need.}\p

column10:
〈Ganda〉\n
{These lands are all yours.}\p

{Here you'll be able to raise every Pom you tame. Use this place however you like!}\p

{Before long, this will become a paradise for Poms. A place they can call home.}\p

{That way, Poms will never turn into Mooms again!}\p

{There has to be a reason this is happening... But for now, the best we can do is make sure they're happy.}\p

{Oh, yes...Listen well, [lulu]. Poms require <food>!}\p

{While looking for Poms is important, finding <food> for them is equally important.}\p

{Poms are [em]big[/em] eaters, so you need a [em]lot[/em] of food!}\p

{Also, it seems that Poms possess special powers.}\p

{There may be times when their powers are necessary to progress.}\p

{That's why you must raise them properly!}\p

{That is all I can say...}\p

{Take this, [lulu]. It's not much, but use this money to buy whatever you need.}\p

column7:
PARTIAL DUPE: F262
NOTE: though this dialogue appears to be an alternate version of the previous messages that would be used if a pom is in the party, that's not possible unless you clear the dungeon, go to the community, then come back to open the chest, making it extremely unlikely for anyone to encounter it... and even then it's still not used. there are several more "if you already have a pom with you" messages like this for the first dungeon, none of which are used.
my speculation is that these may be leftovers from a demo version of the game that started you off with a pom in your party to showcase their mechanics early in the game, but who knows.

column5:
\n
　　　〈ポムのヒミツ〉\p

ポムのクラスは、全部で\n
〈１６〉しゅるいあるみょ。\n
うち〈３〉しゅるいが―ー\p

〈とつぜんへんいポム〉で\n
カラダのイロが　ちがうんだみょ！\n
それから、ＬＶが上がることで―ー\p

クラスアップするしょくぎょうが\n
２つあるみょ！　１つは〈学者〉。\n
この〈図書館〉が建ったのは―ー\p

学者がいたからだみょ！\n
もう１つは〈神父〉か\n
〈シスター〉からナニかに―ー\p

クラスアップするみょ！\n
なんになるかはヒミツなんだみょ！\p
column6:
[center]
<Secret of the Poms>\p
[center]

There are <16> different Pom classes, [myo]. Of them, <3> are <mutations>, recognizable by their different color, [myo]!\p

There are two classes that can only be reached through leveling up, [myo]!\p

One of them is the <Scholar>, [myo]. If you're in the <Library>, then you must have a Scholar, [myo]!\p

The other one comes from the <Reverend> or <Nun> class, [myo]. That class is...\p

...a secret, [myo]!\p

\n
　　　〈女神様のヒミツ〉\p

月の女神〈セラヴィー〉様は\n
いつも　ちきうを　みまもって\n
おられたんだみょ。\p

でも、いつしか　へいわに\n
なれきってしまった人間たちは\n
女神様のことを　わすれ―ー\p

だんだんと〈よこしまなキモチ〉が\n
生まれてしまったんだみょ！\n
その　おかげで月は　きえ―ー\p

地上の生物は〈ジャマモノ〉に\n
なってしまってるんだみょ！\p
column6:
[center]
<Secret of the Goddess>\p
[center]

Lady <Seravy>, the Moon Goddess, always watched over Arth, [myo].\p

But humans grew accustomed to peace, forgetting about the Goddess, [myo].\p

They started developing <wicked feelings>, [myo]!\p

That's what turned animals into <monsters>, [myo]!\p

column6:
[center]
<Secret of the Mooms>\p
[center]

Apparently, when we Poms are exposed to the Arth's <wicked feelings>, we turn into savage <Mooms>, [myo].\p

We think that might be the reason we were thrown down here to <Arth>, [myo]!\p

The only way to confirm it is to go back to the Moon, [myo]... We hope that day comes soon, [myo].\p

〈トネリコ〉\n
「そのせつは　どうもありがとう。\n
　ここで　しばらく―ー\p

「やっかいになろうと　おもう。\n
　じつは　わし、世界に　ちらばる\n
　<Trading Card>を―ー\p

「集めておるのじゃ。\n
　<Trading Card>は\n
　全部で〈４２〉まいあって―ー\p

「宝バコや、町の人たちが\n
　こ〜っそり\n
　かくしもってたりするから―ー\p

「なかなか\n
　てに　はいらないんじゃ。\p

「いろんな所をコマメに\n
　しらべてみると\n
　みつかりやすいかもの。\p

「もし、カードをもってるのなら\n
　わしのもつ　めずらしい\n
　アイテムと　こうかんして―ー\p

「ほしいんじゃが‥‥。\n
　ほかでは　めったに\n
　てに　はいらない―ー\p

「レアなアイテムばかりじゃよ。\n
　どうかな‥‥？\p

「ちなみに、カードに〈Ｐ〉と\n
　書いてあるのはキラキラかがやく\n
　〈プリズムカード〉で―ー\p

「きちょうな物だから、みつけたら\n
　すなおに　よろこぶのが良い。\n
　―ー解ったかな？\p

「それじゃ、たくさん集めて\n
　わしとステキなアイテムを\n
　トレードするとしよう！\p
column6:
〈Tonerko〉\n
{Thank ye again for helpin' me out, miss! I'm truly grateful, so I am!}\p

{I've decided to open up shop here for a while.}\p

{Truth is, I've been tryin' to collect all of the <Trading Cards> scattered all over the world, so I have!}\p

{There are <42> of them, but they're hidden in treasure chests, or inside people's abodes!}\p

{That's why they're so hard to come upon, so they are!}\p

{One must peer into every last nook to find them!}\p

{And so, here's me proposal, miss. If ye happen to find those cards...}\p

{I'd gladly exchange them for me rare items, so I would!}\p

{I assure ye, they're all incredibly rare items ye cannot find elsewhere!}\p

{By the by, cards with a ☆ are called <Foils>. They glitter and sparkle when ye look at them, so they do!}\p

{Oh, how I love them! I could carry on about them for hours!}\p

{...But I digress. Do we have a deal? Excellent! Glad to be doin' business with ye, miss!}\p

　しらべてみると\n
　みつかりやすいかもの。}\p

{もし、カードをもってるのなら\n
　わしのもつ　めずらしい\n
　アイテムと　こうかんして―ー}\p

{ほしいんじゃが‥‥。\n
　ほかでは　めったに\n
　てに　はいらない―ー}\p

{レアなアイテムばかりじゃよ。\n
　どうかな‥‥？}\p

{ちなみに、カードに〈Ｐ〉と\n
　書いてあるのはキラキラかがやく\n
　〈プリズムカード〉で―ー}\p

{きちょうな物だから、みつけたら\n
　すなおに　よろこぶのが良い。\n
　―ー解ったかな？}\p

{それじゃ、たくさん集めて\n
　わしとステキなアイテムを\n
　トレードするとしよう！}\p
column10:
〈Tonerko〉\n
{Thank ye again for helpin' me out, miss!\n
I'm truly grateful, so I am!}\p

{I've decided to open up shop here for a while.}\p

{Truth is, I've been tryin' to collect all of the <Trading Cards> scattered all over the world, so I have!}\p

{There are <42> of them, but they're hidden in treasure chests, or inside someone's abode!}\p

{That's why they're so hard to come upon, so they are!}\p

{One must search every nook and cranny to find them!}\p

{And so, here's me proposal, miss. If ye happen to find those cards...}\p

{I'd gladly exchange them for one of me rare items, so I would!}\p

{I assure ye, they're all incredibly rare items ye cannot find elsewhere!}\p

{By the by, cards with a ☆ are called <Foils>. They glitter and sparkle when ye look at them, so they do!}\p

{Oh, how I love them! I could talk about them for hours!}\p

{...But I digress. Do we have a deal? Excellent! Glad to be doin' business with ye, miss!}\p

　めくれば１ミス回復する。\p

column6:
{Okay, listen up.\n
You'll find 16 panels in the room. Pick any 2 of them.}\p

{If it's a match, you get the item drawn on the panel.}\p

{If they don't match, that's a strike. Get 4 strikes and the game is over.}\p

{But if you find your cute little face on a panel, you get one extra chance.}\p

{Match all panels and you get something special.}\p

{That's about it.\n
Are you ready to play?}\p

We interrupt this program\n
to bring you some...\n
<POM COOL TRIVIA>!\p
[center]

How is [lulu] able to understand what Hawron says? The answer is simple!\p

Due to her wild disposition, she can somewhat understand the language of animals!\p

Incidentally, Hawron and Coloron can understand human language due to their own natural wild instincts.\p

[center]
...We now return to your\n
regularly scheduled\n
<Community Pom>...\p
[center]

NOTE: we have the official strategy guide for this game, and it states that hint 2 is meaningless and you should just keep pushing the buttons until it works. seriously, that's what it tells you.
the actual mechanics are convoluted: you need to hit any 3 of the buttons at least 4 times each in total, at which point hitting the remaining button will immediately open the door.

column6:
〈Ganda〉\n
{Whatever ate the Meymeys must be hiding somewhere in the forest!}\p

{You can't leave any stone unturned in your search for it!}\p

{...Though I suppose you've never been one to do things by halves anyway.[nbsp][sweat]}\p

{What else would possess you to parade around dressed up like a little witch in this day and age?}\p

{I suppose that staff you received from the Poms [em]does[/em] allow you to cast magic to an extent...}\p

{...But you won't get far in your adventure without learning powerful spells.}\p

{There should still be some <Legendary Grimoires> left in our continent.}\p

{I expect that learning their secrets would be quite the boon to your quest!}\p

column6:
〈Ganda〉\n
{Indeed.}\p

{If we show the people that they can be good pets, they'll have nothing to complain about.}\p

{At the same time, we'll make sure all the Poms are good little critters!}\p
column7: NOTE: i get that the idea here is the poms are being treated like pets rather than sentient beings... which is vaguely disturbing now that i think about it... and that "good boy/girl" is the closest English equivalent to 良い子 in this context, but it just feels a little uncomfortable to me to be referring to them as "boys" in such an ostentatious way when they're also explicitly stated not to have sexes. so i'm taking a slightly less direct route here.

column7: NOTE: the game has some odd issue determining the number of digits to print when trying to display an amount divisible by 100, and will end up showing one less zero than it's supposed to. rather than fix the root problem, the programmer appears to have taken the rather baffling route of adding extra logic to the scripts to manually print an additional zero in this case, which is what this string is used for.

column7:
I think this "Goro Akechiko" is a parody of "Gourmet Detective Goro Akechi". For now I'll keep the name "Goro", but I think we should probably swap it to some other detective parody name. I don't want to go for Sherlock Holmes... I'm thinking of a parody of Lieutenant Columbo or Thomas Magnum (Magnum PI). Let's workshop it a bit next time.
-- to sum up an earlier discussion: this guy is parodying the classic Japanese detective Kogoro Akechi (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kogoro_Akechi), though the depiction here seems to be more closely based on Kogoro Mori from Detective Conan (a "highly flawed and lecherous private detective"), whose anime adaptation would have begun its run the year before this game came out

column7: I want to note that I made up something for these two "songs", because the first one says something along the lines of "Houron's 'hou' is the same 'hou' as in 'mahou'", and that's completely untranslateable. In this one, he wonders what the 'Co' in "Coloron" would mean. I checked and Hawron's "hou" being the same as "mahou" doesn't seem to be plot relevant, so it's probably nonsensical. If it turns out to be plot relevant I'll rethink these lines.

〈みなみの老木〉\n
column9: 〈みなみの老木〉\n

column5:
「ほほぅ‥‥。\n
　ワシに用が　あるとは。\p

「ほんに　ひさしぶりの\n
　キャク人じゃ。\p

「―ーしかしの。\n
　ワシのちしきを　わけて\n
　やっても　いいのじゃが―ー\p

「すこし　たのみを\n
　きいては　くれんかの。\p

「〈ジリリ砂漠〉の方に\n
　ワシと　おなじような大木が\n
　もう１本、たっておる。\p

「そやつは〈きたの老木〉\n
　と、いうのじゃが‥‥。\p

「―ーしゃべれんのじゃ。\n
　年のせいかのぉ‥‥\n
　さいきん　すっかり―ー\p

「ねむって　ばかりじゃ。\n
　じゃから、すこし　えいようを\n
　あたえてやっては　くれんか。\p

「‥‥おっと、それから\n
　えいようは〈ひる〉に\n
　あたえるようにな。\p

「たのんだぞ‥‥。\p
column6:
{My, my... It has been a long time since someone last needed my assistance.}\p

{A very long time indeed...}\p

{I do not mind sharing my knowledge with you, but would you mind doing me a favor first?}\p

{You see, there is another like me in the <Scorching Desert>... The <Old Tree of the North>.}\p

{However, he has not been talking to me at all recently. All he ever does is sleep...\n
Must be old age.}\p

{I would like you to give him some kind of pick-me-up, something that would give him some pep.}\p

{Oh, and make sure to do it at <noon>.}\p

{Thank you, little girl.}\p

column5:
〈みなみの老木〉\n
「この大陸のある星‥‥\n
　〈ちきう〉のまわりには―ー\p

「月が回っておった。\n
　月は、ワシら〈ちきう〉に―ー\p

「すむ者すべてに　やすらぎを\n
　あたえとった。\p

「それは月の女神\n
　〈セラヴィー〉のおかげじゃ。\p

「しかし‥‥月は　きえた。\n
　女神に　なにが　おこったのか？\n
　ワシには解らん。\p

「それからじゃの‥‥\n
　大陸に〈ジャマモノ〉どもが\n
　あふれだしたのも‥‥。\p

「人間たちは月が　なくとも\n
　なんとも　おもっちゃいない。\p

「月が　どれだけ\n
　人のこころに作用していたかなど\n
　まるで解っちゃおらん。\p

「いつしか人のこころに　ひそむ\n
　〈よこしまなキモチ〉は\n
　大きくなってしまった。\p

「人間は　ほかの生物と\n
　きょうぞんしてるということを\n
　わすれかけておる。\p

「〈ちきう〉は人間たちだけの\n
　ものではない、というのにの。\p

「―ーワシは月が　しんぱいじゃ。\n
　きっと月では\n
　なにかが　おこっとる。\p

「―ー[lulu]。\n
　おぬしは月に行き\n
　女神に　あうのじゃ。\p

「人間たちを‥‥そして\n
　〈ちきう〉を　これいじょう\n
　けがしては　ならん。\p

「―ーさ、いそぐのじゃ！\n
　おさなき月魔法使いよ!!\p
column6:
〈Old Tree of the South〉\n
{The Moon orbits around planet <Arth>...}\p

{That is to say, this very planet, where our continent resides.}\p

{The living creatures of <Arth> have always lived in peace and comfort thanks to the power of the Moon Goddes <Seravy>.}\p

{But now the Moon is gone...\n
Did something happen to the Goddess?\n
Not even I know the answer.}\p

{Ever since the Moon vanished, <monsters> have started running rampant.}\p

{However, humans do not seem to care about the Moon's disappearance.}\p

{They do not realize just how much influence it had on them.}\p

{Slowly and steadily, <wicked feelings> began to develop within their hearts.}\p

{Humanity has forgotten that it is supposed to coexist with other living creatures...}\p

{...That the <Arth> does not belong only to them.}\p

{I am terribly worried about the Moon.\n
Something must have happened there.}\p

{[lulu].\n
You must go to the Moon and see the Goddess.}\p

{Humanity―the <Arth>―has suffered enough.}\p

{Hurry, young Lunagician!}\p

column5: 〈みなみの老木〉\n

「ほほぅ‥‥。\n
　ワシに用が　あるとは。\p

「ほんに　ひさしぶりの\n
　キャク人じゃ。\p

「―ーしかしの。\n
　ワシのちしきを　わけて\n
　やっても　いいのじゃが―ー\p

「すこし　たのみを\n
　きいては　くれんかの。\p

「〈ジリリ砂漠〉の方に\n
　ワシと　おなじような大木が\n
　もう１本、たっておる。\p

「そやつは〈きたの老木〉\n
　と、いうのじゃが‥‥。\p

「―ーしゃべれんのじゃ。\n
　年のせいかのぉ‥‥\n
　さいきん　すっかり―ー\p

「ねむって　ばかりじゃ。\n
　じゃから、すこし　えいようを\n
　あたえてやっては　くれんか。\p

「‥‥おっと、それから\n
　えいようは〈ひる〉に\n
　あたえるようにな。\p

「たのんだぞ‥‥。\p
column6:
{My, my... It has been a long time since someone last needed my assistance.}\p

{A very long time indeed...}\p

{I do not mind sharing my knowledge with you, but would you mind doing me a favor first?}\p

{You see, there is another like me in the <Scorching Desert>... The <Old Tree of the North>.}\p

{However, he has not been talking to me at all recently. All he ever does is sleep...\n
Must be old age.}\p

{I would like you to give him some kind of pick-me-up, something that would give him some pep.}\p

{Oh, and make sure to do it at <noon>.}\p

{Thank you, little girl.}\p

column5:
「おぬし‥‥まだ\n
　ヤツを　おこしてないのか？\p

「はやく〈きた〉のヤツを\n
　おこすのじゃ！\n
　はるか〈ジリリ砂漠〉に―ー\p

「ヤツ‥‥〈きたの老木〉はいる。\n
　まひるに〈畑のひりょう〉を\n
　あたえるのじゃ！\p
column6:
{It seems he is still sleeping.}\p

{Hurry up and wake that old-timer!}\p

{Go to the <Scorching Desert> and give the <Old Tree of the North> some <Fertilizer> at <noon>!}\p

column5:
「―ーどうやら、やつとも\n
　はなせたようじゃの。\p

「それでは\n
　ワシも　はなしてやろう。\p

「なぜ、月が\n
　なくなってしまったかをの‥‥。\p
column6:
{It appears you have managed to speak with him.}\p

{In that case, I will tell you my side of the story.}\p

{This is the reason the Moon has vanished from the heavens...}\p

column5:
〈みなみの老木〉\n
「この大陸のある星‥‥\n
　〈ちきう〉のまわりには―ー\p

「月が回っておった。\n
　月は、ワシら〈ちきう〉に―ー\p

「すむ者すべてに　やすらぎを\n
　あたえとった。\p

「それは月の女神\n
　〈セラヴィー〉のおかげじゃ。\p

「しかし‥‥月は　きえた。\n
　女神に　なにが　おこったのか？\n
　ワシには解らん。\p

「それからじゃの‥‥\n
　大陸に〈ジャマモノ〉どもが\n
　あふれだしたのも‥‥。\p

「人間たちは月が　なくとも\n
　なんとも　おもっちゃいない。\p

「月が　どれだけ\n
　人のこころに作用していたかなど\n
　まるで解っちゃおらん。\p

「いつしか人のこころに　ひそむ\n
　〈よこしまなキモチ〉は\n
　大きくなってしまった。\p

「人間は　ほかの生物と\n
　きょうぞんしてるということを\n
　わすれかけておる。\p

「〈ちきう〉は人間たちだけの\n
　ものではない、というのにの。\p

「―ーワシは月が　しんぱいじゃ。\n
　きっと月では\n
　なにかが　おこっとる。\p

「―ー[lulu]。\n
　おぬしは月に行き\n
　女神に　あうのじゃ。\p

「人間たちを‥‥そして\n
　〈ちきう〉を　これいじょう\n
　けがしては　ならん。\p

「―ーさ、いそぐのじゃ！\n
　おさなき月魔法使いよ!!\p
column6:
〈Old Tree of the South〉\n
{The Moon orbits around planet <Arth>...}\p

{That is to say, this very planet, where our continent resides.}\p

{The living creatures of <Arth> have always lived in peace and comfort thanks to the power of the Moon Goddes <Seravy>.}\p

{But now the Moon is gone...\n
Did something happen to the Goddess?\n
Not even I know the answer.}\p

{Ever since the Moon vanished, <monsters> have started running rampant.}\p

{However, humans do not seem to care about the Moon's disappearance.}\p

{They do not realize just how much influence it had on them.}\p

{Slowly and steadily, <wicked feelings> began to develop within their hearts.}\p

{Humanity has forgotten that it is supposed to coexist with other living creatures...}\p

{...That the <Arth> does not belong only to them.}\p

{I am terribly worried about the Moon.\n
Something must have happened there.}\p

{[lulu].\n
You must go to the Moon and see the Goddess.}\p

{Humanity―the <Arth>―has suffered enough.}\p

{Hurry, young Lunagician!}\p

column5:
「なにを　しとる！\n
　いそぐのじゃ!!\p

「月へは砂漠の中にある\n
　〈ポコペン塔〉から\n
　行くことが　できる。\p

「もし月から　この地に　もどり\n
　ふたたび月へ行きたい時は\n
　ワシに　あいにくるのじゃ!!\p
column6:
{What are you waiting for?!\n
You must hurry!}\p

{The way to the Moon lies within the <Holey Tower> in the desert.}\p

{If you come back to Arth and wish to return to the Moon, come talk to me!}\p

column5:
「‥‥良くきた。ワシこそが\n
　月の〈いりぐち〉にして―ー\p

「〈でぐち〉―ー\n
　〈ムーン・ゲート〉じゃ。\p

「それでは　ふたたび行くがよい。\n
　女神が　えらんだ\n
　おさなき月魔法使いよ！\p
column6:
{...I am both the <entrance> and the <exit> of the Moon...\n
the <Moon Gate>.}\p

〈[lulu]〉\n
「あ！\n
　〈メェメェ〉だ!!\p

〈メェメェ〉\n
「メェ〜[sweat]\p

\n
〈メェメェ〉を　つれてくよ！\p

〈[lulu]〉\n
「アレ!?　もうもてないや‥‥[sweat]\n
　しかたない、もどしとこ―ー。\p
column6:
〈[lulu]〉\n
{Huh? I can't carry any more...[nbsp][sweat]\n
Oh well, let's put it back.}\p

column5: 〈みなみの老木〉\n

「ほほぅ‥‥。\n
　ワシに用が　あるとは。\p

「ほんに　ひさしぶりの\n
　キャク人じゃ。\p

「―ーしかしの。\n
　ワシのちしきを　わけて\n
　やっても　いいのじゃが―ー\p

「すこし　たのみを\n
　きいては　くれんかの。\p

「〈ジリリ砂漠〉の方に\n
　ワシと　おなじような大木が\n
　もう１本、たっておる。\p

「そやつは〈きたの老木〉\n
　と、いうのじゃが‥‥。\p

「―ーしゃべれんのじゃ。\n
　年のせいかのぉ‥‥\n
　さいきん　すっかり―ー\p

「ねむって　ばかりじゃ。\n
　じゃから、すこし　えいようを\n
　あたえてやっては　くれんか。\p

「‥‥おっと、それから\n
　えいようは〈ひる〉に\n
　あたえるようにな。\p

「たのんだぞ‥‥。\p
column6:
{My, my... It has been a long time since someone last needed my assistance.}\p

{A very long time indeed...}\p

{I do not mind sharing my knowledge with you, but would you mind doing me a favor first?}\p

{You see, there is another like me in the <Scorching Desert>... The <Old Tree of the North>.}\p

{However, he has not been talking to me at all recently. All he ever does is sleep...\n
Must be old age.}\p

{I would like you to give him some kind of pick-me-up, something that would give him some pep.}\p

{Oh, and make sure to do it at <noon>.}\p

{Thank you, little girl.}\p

column5:
「おぬし‥‥まだ\n
　ヤツを　おこしてないのか？\p

「はやく〈きた〉のヤツを\n
　おこすのじゃ！\n
　はるか〈ジリリ砂漠〉に―ー\p

「ヤツ‥‥〈きたの老木〉はいる。\n
　まひるに〈畑のひりょう〉を\n
　あたえるのじゃ！\p
column6:
{It seems he is still sleeping.}\p

{Hurry up and wake that old-timer!}\p

{Go to the <Scorching Desert> and give the <Old Tree of the North> some <Fertilizer> at <noon>!}\p

column5:
「―ーどうやら、やつとも\n
　はなせたようじゃの。\p

「それでは\n
　ワシも　はなしてやろう。\p

「なぜ、月が\n
　なくなってしまったかをの‥‥。\p
column6:
{It appears you have managed to speak with him.}\p

{In that case, I will tell you my side of the story.}\p

{This is the reason the Moon has vanished from the heavens...}\p

column5:
〈みなみの老木〉\n
「この大陸のある星‥‥\n
　〈ちきう〉のまわりには―ー\p

「月が回っておった。\n
　月は、ワシら〈ちきう〉に―ー\p

「すむ者すべてに　やすらぎを\n
　あたえとった。\p

「それは月の女神\n
　〈セラヴィー〉のおかげじゃ。\p

「しかし‥‥月は　きえた。\n
　女神に　なにが　おこったのか？\n
　ワシには解らん。\p

「それからじゃの‥‥\n
　大陸に〈ジャマモノ〉どもが\n
　あふれだしたのも‥‥。\p

「人間たちは月が　なくとも\n
　なんとも　おもっちゃいない。\p

「月が　どれだけ\n
　人のこころに作用していたかなど\n
　まるで解っちゃおらん。\p

「いつしか人のこころに　ひそむ\n
　〈よこしまなキモチ〉は\n
　大きくなってしまった。\p

「人間は　ほかの生物と\n
　きょうぞんしてるということを\n
　わすれかけておる。\p

「〈ちきう〉は人間たちだけの\n
　ものではない、というのにの。\p

「―ーワシは月が　しんぱいじゃ。\n
　きっと月では\n
　なにかが　おこっとる。\p

「―ー[lulu]。\n
　おぬしは月に行き\n
　女神に　あうのじゃ。\p

「人間たちを‥‥そして\n
　〈ちきう〉を　これいじょう\n
　けがしては　ならん。\p

「―ーさ、いそぐのじゃ！\n
　おさなき月魔法使いよ!!\p
column6:
〈Old Tree of the South〉\n
{The Moon orbits around planet <Arth>...}\p

{That is to say, this very planet, where our continent resides.}\p

{The living creatures of <Arth> have always lived in peace and comfort thanks to the power of the Moon Goddes <Seravy>.}\p

{But now the Moon is gone...\n
Did something happen to the Goddess?\n
Not even I know the answer.}\p

{Ever since the Moon vanished, <monsters> have started running rampant.}\p

{However, humans do not seem to care about the Moon's disappearance.}\p

{They do not realize just how much influence it had on them.}\p

{Slowly and steadily, <wicked feelings> began to develop within their hearts.}\p

{Humanity has forgotten that it is supposed to coexist with other living creatures...}\p

{...That the <Arth> does not belong only to them.}\p

{I am terribly worried about the Moon.\n
Something must have happened there.}\p

{[lulu].\n
You must go to the Moon and see the Goddess.}\p

{Humanity―the <Arth>―has suffered enough.}\p

{Hurry, young Lunagician!}\p

column5:
「なにを　しとる！\n
　いそぐのじゃ!!\p

「月へは砂漠の中にある\n
　〈ポコペン塔〉から\n
　行くことが　できる。\p

「もし月から　この地に　もどり\n
　ふたたび月へ行きたい時は\n
　ワシに　あいにくるのじゃ!!\p
column6:
{What are you waiting for?!\n
You must hurry!}\p

{The way to the Moon lies within the <Holey Tower> in the desert.}\p

{If you come back to Arth and wish to return to the Moon, come talk to me!}\p

column5:
「‥‥良くきた。ワシこそが\n
　月の〈いりぐち〉にして―ー\p

「〈でぐち〉―ー\n
　〈ムーン・ゲート〉じゃ。\p

「それでは　ふたたび行くがよい。\n
　女神が　えらんだ\n
　おさなき月魔法使いよ！\p
column6:
{...I am both the <entrance> and the <exit> of the Moon...\n
the <Moon Gate>.}\p

{Now go, young Lunagician chosen by the Goddess!}\p

　女神に　あうのじゃ。\p

「人間たちを‥‥そして\n
　〈ちきう〉を　これいじょう\n
　けがしては　ならん。\p

「―ーさ、いそぐのじゃ！\n
　おさなき月魔法使いよ!!\p
column6:
〈Old Tree of the South〉\n
{The Moon orbits around planet <Arth>...}\p

{That is to say, this very planet, where our continent resides.}\p

{The living creatures of <Arth> have always lived in peace and comfort thanks to the power of the Moon Goddes <Seravy>.}\p

{But now the Moon is gone...\n
Did something happen to the Goddess?\n
Not even I know the answer.}\p

{Ever since the Moon vanished, <monsters> have started running rampant.}\p

{However, humans do not seem to care about the Moon's disappearance.}\p

{They do not realize just how much influence it had on them.}\p

{Slowly and steadily, <wicked feelings> began to develop within their hearts.}\p

{Humanity has forgotten that it is supposed to coexist with other living creatures...}\p

{...That the <Arth> does not belong only to them.}\p

{I am terribly worried about the Moon.\n
Something must have happened there.}\p

{[lulu].\n
You must go to the Moon and see the Goddess.}\p

{Humanity―the <Arth>―has suffered enough.}\p

{Hurry, young Lunagician!}\p

column5:
「なにを　しとる！\n
　いそぐのじゃ!!\p

「月へは砂漠の中にある\n
　〈ポコペン塔〉から\n
　行くことが　できる。\p

「もし月から　この地に　もどり\n
　ふたたび月へ行きたい時は\n
　ワシに　あいにくるのじゃ!!\p
column6:
{What are you waiting for?!\n
You must hurry!}\p

{The way to the Moon lies within the <Holey Tower> in the desert.}\p

{If you come back to Arth and wish to return to the Moon, come talk to me!}\p

「それでは　ふたたび行くがよい。\n
　女神が　えらんだ\n
　おさなき月魔法使いよ！\p
column6:

column5: 〈みなみの老木〉\n

「ほほぅ‥‥。\n
　ワシに用が　あるとは。\p

「ほんに　ひさしぶりの\n
　キャク人じゃ。\p

「―ーしかしの。\n
　ワシのちしきを　わけて\n
　やっても　いいのじゃが―ー\p

「すこし　たのみを\n
　きいては　くれんかの。\p

「〈ジリリ砂漠〉の方に\n
　ワシと　おなじような大木が\n
　もう１本、たっておる。\p

「そやつは〈きたの老木〉\n
　と、いうのじゃが‥‥。\p

「―ーしゃべれんのじゃ。\n
　年のせいかのぉ‥‥\n
　さいきん　すっかり―ー\p

「ねむって　ばかりじゃ。\n
　じゃから、すこし　えいようを\n
　あたえてやっては　くれんか。\p

「‥‥おっと、それから\n
　えいようは〈ひる〉に\n
　あたえるようにな。\p

「たのんだぞ‥‥。\p
column6:
{My, my... It has been a long time since someone last needed my assistance.}\p

{A very long time indeed...}\p

{I do not mind sharing my knowledge with you, but would you mind doing me a favor first?}\p

{You see, there is another like me in the <Scorching Desert>... The <Old Tree of the North>.}\p

{However, he has not been talking to me at all recently. All he ever does is sleep...\n
Must be old age.}\p

{I would like you to give him some kind of pick-me-up, something that would give him some pep.}\p

{Oh, and make sure to do it at <noon>.}\p

{Thank you, little girl.}\p

column5:
「おぬし‥‥まだ\n
　ヤツを　おこしてないのか？\p

「はやく〈きた〉のヤツを\n
　おこすのじゃ！\n
　はるか〈ジリリ砂漠〉に―ー\p

「ヤツ‥‥〈きたの老木〉はいる。\n
　まひるに〈畑のひりょう〉を\n
　あたえるのじゃ！\p
column6:
{It seems he is still sleeping.}\p

{Hurry up and wake that old-timer!}\p

{Go to the <Scorching Desert> and give the <Old Tree of the North> some <Fertilizer> at <noon>!}\p

column5:
「―ーどうやら、やつとも\n
　はなせたようじゃの。\p

「それでは\n
　ワシも　はなしてやろう。\p

「なぜ、月が\n
　なくなってしまったかをの‥‥。\p
column6:
{It appears you have managed to speak with him.}\p

{In that case, I will tell you my side of the story.}\p

{This is the reason the Moon has vanished from the heavens...}\p

column5:
〈みなみの老木〉\n
「この大陸のある星‥‥\n
　〈ちきう〉のまわりには―ー\p

「月が回っておった。\n
　月は、ワシら〈ちきう〉に―ー\p

「すむ者すべてに　やすらぎを\n
　あたえとった。\p

「それは月の女神\n
　〈セラヴィー〉のおかげじゃ。\p

「しかし‥‥月は　きえた。\n
　女神に　なにが　おこったのか？\n
　ワシには解らん。\p

「それからじゃの‥‥\n
　大陸に〈ジャマモノ〉どもが\n
　あふれだしたのも‥‥。\p

「人間たちは月が　なくとも\n
　なんとも　おもっちゃいない。\p

「月が　どれだけ\n
　人のこころに作用していたかなど\n
　まるで解っちゃおらん。\p

「いつしか人のこころに　ひそむ\n
　〈よこしまなキモチ〉は\n
　大きくなってしまった。\p

「人間は　ほかの生物と\n
　きょうぞんしてるということを\n
　わすれかけておる。\p

「〈ちきう〉は人間たちだけの\n
　ものではない、というのにの。\p

「―ーワシは月が　しんぱいじゃ。\n
　きっと月では\n
　なにかが　おこっとる。\p

「―ー[lulu]。\n
　おぬしは月に行き\n
　女神に　あうのじゃ。\p

「人間たちを‥‥そして\n
　〈ちきう〉を　これいじょう\n
　けがしては　ならん。\p

「―ーさ、いそぐのじゃ！\n
　おさなき月魔法使いよ!!\p

column5:
〈クラフト館〉―ー。\n
クルエラ王ぞくの　ながれをくむ\n
きぞく、クラフトしょゆうの館。\p

クラフトは、クルエラ王をまねき\n
しゃこうかいなど　ひんぱんに\n
行うほどの　めいしゅである。\p

〈クラフト〉は\n
さまざまな　けんきゅうに\n
せいつうしており―ー\p

とくに　れんきんじゅつに\n
ついてのちしきは　ほうふだった。\p
column6:
〈Craft Mansion〉\n
A mansion belonging to the Crafts, a noble family related to the Cruela royalty.\p

The Crafts were one of the most prominent noble families of the kingdom―\p

to such an extent that [em]they[/em] would invite King Cruela to [em]their[/em] social gatherings at their mansion.\p

Sir <Craft> was involved in all sorts of studies, and was known to be particularly versed in the field of alchemy.\p

After their passing, Sir Craft showed himself in public less and less, then stopped altogether.\p

column5:
〈クラフト〉\n
「―ーそうです。\n
　でも、いいのです‥‥。\p

「もし、それが息子だとしても\n
　すでに　その　きおくは\n
　ありますまい‥‥。\p

「―ー女神が　おいかりに\n
　なられた。\p

「わたしは‥‥\n
　してはいけないことを\n
　してしまった。\p

「息子を　あいするあまり\n
　わたしは墓所から\n
　たにんの　いたいを‥‥\p

「そして、息子を\n
　よみがえらせたのです。\p

「―ーしかし\n
　よみがえった〈アルフレッド〉を\n
　メイドたちは、おそれた‥‥。\p

「わたしが　よみがえらせた\n
　息子は、しょせん　しにくの\n
　かたまりでしかなかったのです。\p

「館には、わたしと　よみがえった\n
　息子だけが　のこり、ここで\n
　いく年かを　すごしました。\p

「しかし、わたしは　おいていた。\n
　わたしの命は、じきに\n
　つきようとしていた‥‥。\p

「たった１人のこされるであろう\n
　息子をふびんに　おもった\n
　わたしは―ー\p

「このてで、アルフレッドを\n
　〈封印〉したのです!!\p

「―ー[lulu]さん。\n
　息子を‥‥アルフレッドを\n
　らくにして　やってください。\p

「息子の体を〈炎〉で　もやせば\n
　息子の　たましいは\n
　じゆうになることでしょう‥‥。\p
column6:
〈Craft〉\n
{Correct.\n
I suppose calling him a `devil^ is right...}\p

{He might be my son, but at this point he no longer remembers that...}\p

{This is my punishment, for I have angered the Goddess.}\p

{You see, I... have done something terrible.}\p

{I couldn't accept his loss... Misguided by my love, I stole the corpses of others from this graveyard...}\p

{And I have brought him back from the dead.}\p

{I'll never forget the terror in the maids' eyes when they beheld him...}\p

{After all, my `son^ was nothing more than a moving heap of rotten flesh.}\p

{We stayed here in the mansion alone for... who knows how many years.}\p

{But I knew it could not last. Humans cannot live forever...}\p

{When I realized that he would spend eternity alone here, I...}\p

{I <sealed> Alfred inside the mansion!}\p

{Young [lulu].\n
I know it is much to ask, but...\n
I want you to bring him to peace.}\p

{The only way to free his soul is to let his body burn in <fire>...}\p

column7:
PARTIAL DUPE: F247
NOTE: this card is bugged and awards 2 cards instead of just 1. this would result in it being possible to obtain more than 42 cards, except that card 41 is also bugged and unobtainable in that version. thus, by pure chance, it works out that you can still get the "correct" number of cards in total.
card 41 was made obtainable in the 1999 rerelease, but this bug was not fixed, so it's probably possible to get 43 cards in that version (not going to do a 100% run to check). at any rate, i've fixed both issues for the patch.

column5:
〈クラフト館〉―ー。\n
クルエラ王ぞくの　ながれをくむ\n
きぞく、クラフトしょゆうの館。\p

クラフトは、クルエラ王をまねき\n
しゃこうかいなど　ひんぱんに\n
行うほどの　めいしゅである。\p

〈クラフト〉は\n
さまざまな　けんきゅうに\n
せいつうしており―ー\p

とくに　れんきんじゅつに\n
ついてのちしきは　ほうふだった。\p
column6:
〈Craft Mansion〉\n
A mansion belonging to the Crafts, a noble family related to the Cruela royalty.\p

The Crafts were one of the most prominent noble families of the kingdom―\p

to such an extent that [em]they[/em] would invite King Cruela to [em]their[/em] social gatherings at their mansion.\p

Sir <Craft> was involved in all sorts of studies, and was known to be particularly versed in the field of alchemy.\p

column5:

\n
―ーだって‥‥。\p

なんだか　キミワル〜。\n

ボロボロで　よめないや。\p
column6:

column5:
１８×５年―ー。この年\n
じこにより、つまバネッサと\n
息子のアルフレッドを　なくす。\p

つまと息子を　うしなった\n
クラフトは　しだいに人まえに\n
すがたを　あらわさなくなった。\p
column6:
In 18[X]5, following an accident, Sir Craft lost his wife Vanessa and his son Alfred.\p

After their passing, Sir Craft showed himself in public less and less, then stopped altogether.\p

おなじころ、あたりには\n
いしゅうが　ただよう。それは\n
クラフト館からだとのことも‥‥。\p
column6:
In 18[X]6, a series of <grave robberies> began to occur at the <Mudmud Graveyard>.\p

Around the same time, a foul smell started filling the air. According to some, the smell came from the Craft Mansion...\p

　かたまりでしかなかったのです。\p

　息子だけが　のこり、ここで\n
　いく年かを　すごしました。\p

「しかし、わたしは　おいていた。\n
　わたしの命は、じきに\n
　つきようとしていた‥‥。\p

column6:
〈Craft〉\n
{Correct.\n
I suppose calling him a `devil^ is right...}\p

{He might be my son, but at this point he no longer remembers that...}\p

{This is my punishment, for I have angered the Goddess.}\p

{You see, I... have done something terrible.}\p

{I couldn't accept his loss... Misguided by my love, I stole the corpses of others from this graveyard...}\p

{And I have brought him back from the dead.}\p

{I'll never forget the terror in the maids' eyes when they beheld him...}\p

{After all, my `son^ was nothing more than a moving heap of rotten flesh.}\p

{We stayed here in the mansion alone for... who knows how many years.}\p

{But I knew it could not last. Humans cannot live forever...}\p

{When I realized that he would spend eternity alone here, I...}\p

{I <sealed> Alfred inside the mansion!}\p

{Young [lulu].\n
I know it is much to ask, but...\n
I want you to bring him to peace.}\p

{The only way to free his soul is to let his body burn in <fire>...}\p

column6:
〈Craft Mansion〉\n
A mansion belonging to the Crafts, a noble family related to the Cruela royalty.\p

The Crafts were one of the most prominent noble families of the kingdom―\p

to such an extent that [em]they[/em] would invite King Cruela to [em]their[/em] social gatherings at their mansion.\p

Sir <Craft> was involved in all sorts of studies, and was known to be particularly versed in the field of alchemy.\p

　息子だけが　のこり、ここで\n
　いく年かを　すごしました。\p

「しかし、わたしは　おいていた。\n
　わたしの命は、じきに\n
　つきようとしていた‥‥。\p

「たった１人のこされるであろう\n
　息子をふびんに　おもった\n
　わたしは―ー\p

「このてで、アルフレッドを\n
　〈封印〉したのです!!\p

「―ー[lulu]さん。\n
　息子を‥‥アルフレッドを\n
　らくにして　やってください。\p

「息子の体を〈炎〉で　もやせば\n
　息子の　たましいは\n
　じゆうになることでしょう‥‥。\p
column6:
〈Craft〉\n
{Correct.\n
I suppose calling him a `devil^ is right...}\p

{He might be my son, but at this point he no longer remembers that...}\p

{This is my punishment, for I have angered the Goddess.}\p

{You see, I... have done something terrible.}\p

{I couldn't accept his loss... Misguided by my love, I stole the corpses of others from this graveyard...}\p

{And I have brought him back from the dead.}\p

{I'll never forget the terror in the maids' eyes when they beheld him...}\p

{After all, my `son^ was nothing more than a moving heap of rotten flesh.}\p

{We stayed here in the mansion alone for... who knows how many years.}\p

{But I knew it could not last. Humans cannot live forever...}\p

{When I realized that he would spend eternity alone here, I...}\p

{I <sealed> Alfred inside the mansion!}\p

{Young [lulu].\n
I know it is much to ask, but...\n
I want you to bring him to peace.}\p

{The only way to free his soul is to let his body burn in <fire>...}\p

column6:
The <Wobbly Ruins> on these lands are remnants of an ancient time.\p

They have existed since before our people started living here.\p

Neither those who created this structure, nor their purpose in doing so, are known to us.\p

It was undoubtedly built by an advanced civilization, and some portions even surpass our current knowledge.\p

column10:
The <Wobbly Ruins> have been left on these lands since ancient times.\p

They have existed since before our people have started living here. What the original purpose of this building, nor its purpose, are known to us.\p

Without a doubt, it was built by an advanced civilization, and some portions even surpass our current knowledge.\p

since the boss is a giant talking monster plant, I went for "Audrey IV" as a play on Audrey II from Little Shop of Horrors. Why not Audrey III? Because this way you'll wonder where's Audrey III lol.
Incidentally, the Yukkuris said the original name (flowatchi) is because tamagotchi was popular at the time.
-- apparently "furawatchi" is also an actual tamagotchi... albeit one created years after this game

むかしむかし、大陸に\n
あらわれた　このジャマモノは\n
村や町を　焼きつくし―ー\p

ひとびとを　おそれさせました。\n

魔法使いによって―ー\p

たおされました。\n

おさない　女の子で―ー\p

ひとびとの　さんじを　うける\n
間もなく、すぐに月へ\n
きえていったと　いわれています。\p

<Skeletal Creature>\p
[center]

A long time ago, this monster roamed the continent, bringing chaos and terror by burning down villages and towns.\p

It was eventually defeated by one brave sorceress:\p

a young girl who is said to have left for the Moon before she could even be thanked for her actions.\p

column6:

{That's okay, [myo].\n
We have more pressing matters to discuss, [myo]!}\p

{That's why the Moon lost its light and there's so many monsters on <Arth>, [myo]!}\p

column5:
〈[lulu]〉\n
「―ーでも\n
　いったい　だれが？\p

〈ポム〉\n
「それは〈バサラ〉様だみょ〜。\n
　バサラ様は　もともと―ー\p

「ワルイ人じゃなかったみょ〜！\n
　でも　いつからかワルイ魔女に\n
　なってしまったみょ‥‥[sweat]\p

「女神様を封じたあと\n
　おいらたちを〈ちきう〉に\n
　おとしたんだみょ〜[anger]\p

「〈カカカ〉様が　バサラ様を\n
　とめようとしたけれど\n
　カカカ様も〈ちきう〉に―ー\p

「おとされてしまったみょ〜[sweat]\n
　きっとカカカ様も\n
　〈ちきう〉の　どこかに―ー\p

「いるんだみょ〜。\n
　カカカ様、これがなくて\n
　きっと　こまってるみょ〜！\p

「[lulu]に　これを\n
　あげるみょ〜！\p
column6:
〈Pom〉\n
{It was Lady <Vajra>, [myo]!}\p

{She wasn't always bad, but she's gone full evil witch now, [myo]...[nbsp][sweat]}\p

{Lord <Cackleca> tried to stop her, but he was also thrown down here to <Arth>, [myo]![nbsp][sweat]}\p

{I'm sure he's okay, but who knows where he is now, [myo]!}\p

{I'm actually looking for him, [myo]. He really needs this, [myo]!}\p

{Maybe you should carry it instead, [myo]!}\p

column5:
〈冒険家〉の〈バーダ〉\n
―ーなまえを　かえる？\p
いいよん
やだやだ

〈バーダ〉\n
「

か‥‥。\n
　なかなかイケてるみょ！\p

〈バーダ〉\n
「それじゃ、これからも\n
　〈バーダ〉って　よぶみょ！\p

〈ぷるる遺跡〉は\n
はるかむかしから、この地にのこる\n
ものである。\p

まだ人の　すみつく　いぜんから\n
そんざいし、だれが、なんのために\n
この建物を築いたかは―ー\p

解っていない。しかし、その\n
ぶんかレベルは　きわめてたかく\n
われわれの知しきを　こえた―ー\p

ぶぶんが　いくつも　ある。\p
column6:
The <Wobbly Ruins> on these lands are remnants of an ancient time.\p

They have existed since before our people started living here.\p

Neither those who created this structure, nor their purpose in doing so, are known to us.\p

It was undoubtedly built by an advanced civilization, and some portions even surpass our current knowledge.\p

column5:
ここに　ほぞんされている\n
〈ホネホネ人〉との　かんけいも\n
いっさい　なぞにつつまれている。\p
column6: Their connection with the remains of the <skeletal creature> stored here is also a complete mystery to us.\p

column5:
かつてあった月には女神が\n
すんでおり、その力は―ー\p

〈ちきう〉にも　えいきょうを\n
あたえているといわれている。\p
column6:
The Goddess is said to have lived on the Moon, which has long since been gone from the sky.\p

Her powers are thought to have had a major influence on our <Arth>.\p

column5:
これは〈月生物〉が築いたとか\n
さまざまな　おくそくが\n
なされているが―ー\p

その　しんそうは\n
いまだ解っていない―ー。\p
column6: According to some theories, they were built by <lunar creatures>, but the truth eludes us to this day.\p

むかしむかし、大陸に\n

たおされました。\n

おさない　女の子で―ー\p

ひとびとの　さんじを　うける\n
間もなく、すぐに月へ\n
きえていったと　いわれています。\p
column6:
[center]
<Skeletal Creature>\p
[center]

A long time ago, this monster roamed the continent, bringing chaos and terror by burning down villages and towns.\p

It was eventually defeated by one brave sorceress:\p

a young girl who is said to have left for the Moon before she could even be thanked for her actions.\p

column6:
The <Wobbly Ruins> on these lands are remnants of an ancient time.\p

They have existed since before our people started living here.\p

Neither those who created this structure, nor their purpose in doing so, are known to us.\p

It was undoubtedly built by an advanced civilization, and some portions even surpass our current knowledge.\p

column5:
ここに　ほぞんされている\n
〈ホネホネ人〉との　かんけいも\n
いっさい　なぞにつつまれている。\p
column6: Their connection with the remains of the <skeletal creature> stored here is also a complete mystery to us.\p

column5:
かつてあった月には女神が\n
すんでおり、その力は―ー\p

〈ちきう〉にも　えいきょうを\n
あたえているといわれている。\p
column6:
The Goddess is said to have lived on the Moon, which has long since been gone from the sky.\p

Her powers are thought to have had a major influence on our <Arth>.\p

column5:

column6: According to some theories, they were built by <lunar creatures>, but the truth eludes us to this day.\p

column5:
「―ーおぬしは〈月〉というものを\n
　知っとるか？\p

「ここ　さいきん月が\n
　きえてもうたようじゃが‥‥。\p

「ま、そのハナシは\n
　〈みなみ〉のヤツに\n
　まかしといて‥‥。\p

「わいは〈ポム〉のことを\n
　はなしてやろう。\p

「すでに気づいているとおもうが\n
　おぬしの　あつめているポムは\n
　もともとは月の生物や。\p

「５年まえ、この〈ちきう〉に\n
　〈１６ぴき〉のポムと\n
　ある月の者が　ふってきたんや。\p

「―ーあん時はキレイに\n
　ふってきよったでぇ。\n
　〈ながれぼし〉みたいやったわ。\p

「ま、それはともかく‥‥\n
　ポムは月の生物なんや。\n
　おまえが　あつめているのは―ー\p

「ぐうぜんやない。\n
　おまえはポムを月に\n
　かえしてやらなければならない。\p

「ポムたちが\n
　このまま〈ちきう〉に　いれば\n
　いつか人間に　くちくされる。\p

「それは　かわいそうやないか？\n
　たとえ、このままコミュニティで\n
　おまえが飼っていったとしても\p

「〈ムム〉に　なってしまうことは\n
　ゼッタイさけられまい‥‥。\n
　だから、生まれたところに―ー\p

「かえしてやるのが１番えぇと\n
　おもうんや‥‥。\n
　―ーそうは、おもわんか？\p
column6:
{Do you know about the <Moon>?}\p

{Well, of course you do. I'm referring to the fact that it has disappeared from the heavens.}\p

{I'll leave this conversation to that <South> twig...}\p

{I actually want to talk about <Poms>.}\p

{You probably already know this, but Poms actually come from the Moon.}\p

{Five years ago, <sixteen> Poms fell from the Moon down here, to <Arth>.}\p

{What a sight it was! You should have seen it. They shone like <shooting stars>...}\p

{But I digress.\n
As I mentioned, Poms come from the Moon.}\p

{It is no coincidence that they gather to you. Your purpose is to bring them back to the Moon.}\p

{If they stay here, sooner or later, they will be destroyed by the people of <Arth>.}\p

{That would be very sad, wouldn't you say?}\p

{Even if you keep them all in your Community, you can't stop them from eventually turning into <Mooms>.}\p

{If you truly love them, you must take them back where they belong. Don't you think so as well?}\p

column5:
〈きたの老木〉\n
「[lulu]‥‥。\n
　おまえは　えらばれたんや。\p

「その杖をポムから\n
　うけとった時から　おまえの\n
　行くみちは　きまっとったんや。\p

「―ーやがて　すべてを知る。\n
　ちかぢか、おまえは\n
　月に行くことになるやろ‥‥。\p

「とりあえず〈ジリリ砂漠〉にある\n
　〈ポコペン塔〉をめざすんや。\p

「そこには\n
　おまえを　まっている者がいる。\n
　その者の力をかり―ー\p

「月に行くが良い。\p

「まかせたぞ。\n
　―ーそれから\n
　みなみのヤツにも　よろしくな。\p
column6:

{[lulu]...\n
You are the chosen one.}\p

{This was to be your destiny ever since the Poms gifted you that staff.}\p

{Soon you will reach the Moon... Then you will understand everything.}\p

{For now, go to the <Holey Tower> in the <Scorching Desert>.}\p

{There you will find someone who can help you go to the Moon.}\p

{The rest is up to you...\n
Bring my regards to the South twig.}\p

column7:
[CHECK] [SECRETMESSAGE]
the full message is:
ねじゅみはなび１→炎×１→
氷×１→たたく×１０＝！！
you get the missing letters from Baksheesh in town.
the full translated message is:
Bomb Spinner x1 → Fire x1 →
Ice x1 → Bash x10 = !!
basically half the message is missing, and you need to mix both to understand it.
Here are the two "corrupted" versions for now. This might need some work, so I'll leave it as comment for the time being:

Bo×× ××inn×× x1 → Fi×× x× →
××e x1 → B××h x×0 = !!

××mb Sp×××er x1 → ××re x1 →
Ic× x1 → ×as× x1× = !!
-- this looks fine to me

{I actually want to talk about <Poms>.}\p

{You probably already know this, but Poms actually come from the Moon.}\p

{Five years ago, <sixteen> Poms fell from the Moon down here, to <Arth>.}\p

{What a sight it was! You should have seen it. They shone like <shooting stars>...}\p

{But I digress.\n
As I mentioned, Poms come from the Moon.}\p

{It is no coincidence that they gather to you. Your purpose is to bring them back to the Moon.}\p

{If they stay here, sooner or later, they will be destroyed by the people of <Arth>.}\p

{That would be very sad, wouldn't you say?}\p

{Even if you keep them all in your Community, you can't stop them from eventually turning into <Mooms>.}\p

{If you truly love them, you must take them back where they belong. Don't you think so as well?}\p

column5:
〈きたの老木〉\n
「[lulu]‥‥。\n
　おまえは　えらばれたんや。\p

「その杖をポムから\n
　うけとった時から　おまえの\n
　行くみちは　きまっとったんや。\p

「―ーやがて　すべてを知る。\n
　ちかぢか、おまえは\n
　月に行くことになるやろ‥‥。\p

「とりあえず〈ジリリ砂漠〉にある\n
　〈ポコペン塔〉をめざすんや。\p

「そこには\n
　おまえを　まっている者がいる。\n
　その者の力をかり―ー\p

「月に行くが良い。\p

「まかせたぞ。\n
　―ーそれから\n
　みなみのヤツにも　よろしくな。\p
column6:

{[lulu]...\n
You are the chosen one.}\p

{This was to be your destiny ever since the Poms gifted you that staff.}\p

{Soon you will reach the Moon... Then you will understand everything.}\p

{For now, go to the <Holey Tower> in the <Scorching Desert>.}\p

{There you will find someone who can help you go to the Moon.}\p

{The rest is up to you...\n
Bring my regards to the South twig.}\p

column5:
〈きたの老木〉\n
「―ーふわぁ〜‥‥よく\n
　ねとったわい。\p

「なんじゃ　おぬしは‥‥？\n
　―ーはっはーん。さては\n
　わいに　ふるいはなしを―ー\p

「ききたいって　やからじゃな。\n
　ま、えじゃろ。うまいもん\n
　食わしてもらったからの‥‥。\p
column6:
〈Old Tree of the North〉\n
{*yaaawn*\n
I slept like a log.}\p

{Hm? Who might you be?\n
Ahh, I get it. You must be here to listen to one of my old tales.}\p

{Very well. You deserve that much for bringing me such a delightful treat.}\p

column5:
「―ーおぬしは〈月〉というものを\n
　知っとるか？\p

「ここ　さいきん月が\n
　きえてもうたようじゃが‥‥。\p

「ま、そのハナシは\n
　〈みなみ〉のヤツに\n
　まかしといて‥‥。\p

「わいは〈ポム〉のことを\n
　はなしてやろう。\p

「すでに気づいているとおもうが\n
　おぬしの　あつめているポムは\n
　もともとは月の生物や。\p

「５年まえ、この〈ちきう〉に\n
　〈１６ぴき〉のポムと\n
　ある月の者が　ふってきたんや。\p

「―ーあん時はキレイに\n
　ふってきよったでぇ。\n
　〈ながれぼし〉みたいやったわ。\p

「ま、それはともかく‥‥\n
　ポムは月の生物なんや。\n
　おまえが　あつめているのは―ー\p

「ぐうぜんやない。\n
　おまえはポムを月に\n
　かえしてやらなければならない。\p

「ポムたちが\n
　このまま〈ちきう〉に　いれば\n
　いつか人間に　くちくされる。\p

「それは　かわいそうやないか？\n
　たとえ、このままコミュニティで\n
　おまえが飼っていったとしても\p

「〈ムム〉に　なってしまうことは\n
　ゼッタイさけられまい‥‥。\n
　だから、生まれたところに―ー\p

「かえしてやるのが１番えぇと\n
　おもうんや‥‥。\n
　―ーそうは、おもわんか？\p

column5:
〈占いし〉\n
「まよえるリトル・メェメェよ。\n
　よく　まいりました。\p

「わたしは〈ビビッド〉の\n
　ふたごのいもうと―ー\p

「〈ビビディ〉です。\n
　あなたたちの行くさきが\n
　みえます‥‥ハァ〜〜ッ!!\p

「ビビッと　きましたわぁ〜！\n
　〈月伝説〉は　ほんとうでした。\p

「この世界から月が\n
　きえてしまったのは\n
　ポムのせいでは　ありません。\p

「女神〈セラヴィー〉をすくいに\n
　〈ポム〉をつれて月へ\n
　むかうのです。\p

「すべては　そこにあります。\n
　〈ポム〉が\n
　なにものなのかということも―ー\p

「〈ちきう〉から月のひかりが\n
　きえてしまったわけも\n
　すべては　そこで―ー\p

「あきらかになるはずです。\n
　〈ポム〉は\n
　アクマなどではありません。\p

「〈神の使い〉とよばれる\n
　〈せいなるけもの〉なのです。\p

「さぁ、月へ！\n
　月へ　いそいでください!!\p

「神より　おつげがありました！\n
　<Bomb Spinner>を\n
　もって砂漠へ！　ハァ〜〜!!\p
column6:
〈Fortune Teller〉\n
{Welcome, my lost little Meymey.}\p

{I am <Vivienne>'s younger twin sister... <Viviette>.}\p

{I can see your destination...\n
HAAAAH!!}\p

{Yes... I see it... [em]VIVIDLY[/em]!}\p

{So the <Lunar Legend> was right...}\p

{It is not because of the Poms that the Moon has vanished from the sky.}\p

{You must bring the <Poms> back to the Moon in order to save the Goddess <Seravy>.}\p

{The true identity of the <Poms>...\n
Why the Moon stopped illuminating <Arth>...}\p

{All will be revealed there.}\p

{The <Poms> are no demons...\n
Quite the contrary.}\p

{They are <sacred creatures>―\n
<Servants of God>.}\p

{Now hurry!\n
You must go to the Moon!}\p

{I have received an oracle...\n
You must bring a <Bomb Spinner> to the desert!\n
HAAAAH!}\p

{It was not because of the Poms that the Moon has vanished from the sky.}\p

{You must bring the <Poms> back to the Moon in order to save the Goddess <Seravy>.}\p

{The true identity of the <Poms>...\n
Why the Moon stopped illuminating <Arth>...\n
All will be revealed there.}\p

{The <Poms> are no demons...\n
Quite the contrary.}\p

{They are <Sacred creatures>, <Servants of God>.}\p

{Now hurry!\n
You must go to the Moon!}\p

{I have received an oracle...\n
You must bring a <Bomb Spinner> to the desert!\n
HAAAAH!}\p

column7: this is a hint for the Sandworm boss battle in the Holey Tower. If you use a charge attack on the ground during the battle, a metal basin will fall after a short time. You're supposed to time it right so it hits the sandworm on the head.

column5:
〈マハラジャ〉\n
「‥‥あぁ、それから\n
　１つ　オネガイあるデスが―ー\p

「たのまれてくれませんデスか？\p

「これからオイシイ、オイシイ\n
　〈カリィ・スープ〉つくるヨ！\n
　トロ〜リ、オイシイネ〜!!\p

「―ーでも、ウチ\n
　ざいりょう　チョットナイ‥‥。\n
　ニンジンあるけど―ー\p

「<Potato>たりない‥‥。\n
　ハチミツあるけど\n
　<Apple>がナイネ〜‥‥[sweat]\p

「<Apple>ナイと、トロ〜リ\n
　生きない‥‥カリィ・スープ。\n
　チョットだけマズくなるネ！\p

「だから、もってきてほしいネ！\n
　<Potato>と<Apple>を\n
　あと、ついでに<Pumpkin>も！\p

「あ‥‥はなししてたら\n
　オナカすいてきたネ〜。\n
　ワタシ、いますぐ食べたいね〜！\p

「でも、１０日なら　まてる。\n
　じゅくせいカリィよネ〜。\p

「もし、ざいりょう\n
　もってきてくれたら\n
　良い物やるヨ！\p

「〈１０日〉いないに\n
　<Potato>\n
　<Apple><Pumpkin>―ー\p

「もってきたら\n
　このポムやるヨ!!\p
column6:
〈Maharaja〉\n
{Since you're here, I do have a favor to ask...}\p

{I'm going to cook my famous <Curry Soup>! It's thick, and creamy, and most delicious!}\p

{The problem is, I don't have the ingredients!\n
I have all the carrots I need, but I don't have <Potatoes>!}\p

{I have honey, but I don't have <Apples>![nbsp][sweat]}\p

{I [em]really[/em] need <Apples> to get the right thickness... I can't make my special <Curry Soup> without them!}\p

{Long story short, I need <Potatoes> and <Apples>! Oh, and one nice <Pumpkin> too!}\p

{Oooh... Now I'm hungry.\n
I so look forward to it!}\p

{I can wait 10 days.\n
That's how long the soup needs to simmer!}\p

{If you can bring me a <Potato>, an <Apple> and a <Pumpkin> within <10 days>, I'll give you this <Pom>!}\p

〈占いし〉\n
「まよえるリトル・メェメェよ。\n

column6:
〈Fortune Teller〉\n
{Welcome, my lost little Meymey.}\p

{I am <Vivienne>'s younger twin sister... <Viviette>.}\p

{I can see your destination...\n
HAAAAH!!}\p

{Yes... I see it... [em]VIVIDLY[/em]!}\p

{So the <Lunar Legend> was right...}\p

{It is not because of the Poms that the Moon has vanished from the sky.}\p

{You must bring the <Poms> back to the Moon in order to save the Goddess <Seravy>.}\p

{The true identity of the <Poms>...\n
Why the Moon stopped illuminating <Arth>...}\p

{All will be revealed there.}\p

{The <Poms> are no demons...\n
Quite the contrary.}\p

{They are <sacred creatures>―\n
<Servants of God>.}\p

{Now hurry!\n
You must go to the Moon!}\p

You must bring a <Bomb Spinner> to the desert!\n

column5:
〈カカカ〉\n
「バサラはな。ポムが\n
　〈よこしまなキモチ〉をあびると\p

「キョーアクな〈ムム〉に\n
　ヘンシンしてしまうことを\n
　知っとったんや。\p

「それに気づいたヤツは\n
　月よりも〈よこしまなキモチ〉が\n
　あふれる〈ちきう〉に―ー\p

「ポム‥‥いや、ムムを\n
　おくりこみ〈ちきう〉を\n
　ハチャメチャに―ー\p

「しようとしたんや。\n
　そやけど、おもったほど\n
　〈ちきう〉の―ー\p

「〈よこしまなキモチ〉が\n
　よわかったのか、ポムたちは\n
　すぐにムムには　ならんかった。\p

「しかし、強大な力を　てにいれた\n
　バサラのまえに　わては　やぶれ\n
　〈ちきう〉に　おとされたんや。\p

「めだまを　なくした　わては\n
　ほんらいの力を　だせへん。\n
　そんとき、わてはシヴィルに―ー\p

「ひろわれ、おれいとして\n
　すこしだけ力を\n
　かしてやるつもりやった。\p

「そやけど、シヴィルの\n
　〈よこしまなキモチ〉が\n
　チィトばっか強すぎて―ー\p

「わてはシヴィルを\n
　おさえることが　できんかった。\p

「―ーでも、あんさんは\n
　ようやってくれた。\n
　わてのつくった―ー\p

「その〈魔法の杖〉を\n
　使いこなしとるとは‥‥\n
　たいしたもんや！\p

「[lulu]‥‥あんさんはな\n
　５年まえに　すでに\n
　わてらに　えらばれてたんや。\p

「この〈よこしまなキモチ〉で\n
　けがれた大陸で\n
　あんさんほどの―ー\p

「やさしさを　もった者は\n
　だれ１人おらんかった。\n
　ポムたちと　これだけ―ー\p

「仲良くなれた人間は\n
　あんさんだけやった。\n
　だから、ここまで　これたんや。\p

「月や〈ちきう〉や\n
　人間たちを　すくえるのは\n
　―ーあんさんだけや。\p
column6:
〈Cackleca〉\n
{Y'see, Vajra found out Poms exposed to <Wicked Feelings> turn into vicious <Mooms>.}\p

{So, she decided to send 'em somewhere with way more <Wicked Feelings> than the Moon...}\p

{That's the <Arth>.}\p

{But Poms didn't start turning into Mooms as fast as she thought.}\p

{Maybe <Arth>'s <Wicked Feelings> weren't that strong to begin with....}\p

{I tried my darndest to stop her, but she was already too strong for me.}\p

{She banished me down here to <Arth>.}\p

{After I lost my eyeball, I couldn't tap into my real power...}\p

{That's when Sivil found me. I figured I'd lend him some of my power as thanks.}\p

{Things kinda got outta hand, because his <Wicked Feelings> got a liiittle too strong.}\p

{...But ya solved that problem. I'm amazed ya managed to use the <Magic Staff> I made that well... You're pretty good!}\p

{[lulu]... You're the chosen one.\n
We actually chose you five years ago.}\p

{You're the kindest kid in a continent overflowing with <Wicked Feelings>.}\p

{That's why the Poms gather to you. No one else could get along so well with 'em but you.}\p

{You're the only one who can save the Moon, the <Arth>, and all of their people.}\p

{After I lost my eyeball, I couldn't tap into my real power...}\p

{Things kinda got outta hand, because his <Wicked Feelings> got a liiittle too strong.}\p

{...But ya solved that problem. I'm amazed ya managed to use the <Magic Staff> I made that well... You're pretty good!}\p

{[lulu]... You're the chosen one.\n
We actually chose you five years ago.}\p

〈Cackleca〉\n
{Y'see, Vajra found out Poms exposed to <Wicked Feelings> turn into vicious <Mooms>.}\p

{Maybe <Arth>'s <Wicked Feelings> weren't that strong to begin with....}\p

{I tried my darndest to stop her, but she was already too strong for me.}\p

{She banished me down here to <Arth>.}\p

{After I lost my eyeball, I couldn't tap into my real power...}\p

{That's when Sivil found me. I figured I'd lend him some of my power as thanks.}\p

{Things kinda got outta hand, because his <Wicked Feelings> got a liiittle too strong.}\p

{...But ya solved that problem. I'm amazed ya managed to use the <Magic Staff> I made that well... You're pretty good!}\p

{[lulu]... You're the chosen one.\n
We actually chose you five years ago.}\p

{You're the kindest kid in a continent overflowing with <Wicked Feelings>.}\p

{That's why the Poms gather to you. No one else could get along so well with 'em but you.}\p

column6:
〈Cackleca〉\n
{Y'see, Vajra found out Poms exposed to <Wicked Feelings> turn into vicious <Mooms>.}\p

{Maybe <Arth>'s <Wicked Feelings> weren't that strong to begin with....}\p

{I tried my darndest to stop her, but she was already too strong for me.}\p

{She banished me down here to <Arth>.}\p

{After I lost my eyeball, I couldn't tap into my real power...}\p

{That's when Sivil found me. I figured I'd lend him some of my power as thanks.}\p

{Things kinda got outta hand, because his <Wicked Feelings> got a liiittle too strong.}\p

{...But ya solved that problem. I'm amazed ya managed to use the <Magic Staff> I made that well... You're pretty good!}\p

{[lulu]... You're the chosen one.\n
We actually chose you five years ago.}\p

{You're the kindest kid in a continent overflowing with <Wicked Feelings>.}\p

{That's why the Poms gather to you. No one else could get along so well with 'em but you.}\p

{You're the only one who can save the Moon, the <Arth>, and all of their people.}\p

column5: 〈みなみの老木〉\n

「ほほぅ‥‥。\n
　ワシに用が　あるとは。\p

「ほんに　ひさしぶりの\n
　キャク人じゃ。\p

「―ーしかしの。\n
　ワシのちしきを　わけて\n
　やっても　いいのじゃが―ー\p

「すこし　たのみを\n
　きいては　くれんかの。\p

「〈ジリリ砂漠〉の方に\n
　ワシと　おなじような大木が\n
　もう１本、たっておる。\p

「そやつは〈きたの老木〉\n
　と、いうのじゃが‥‥。\p

「―ーしゃべれんのじゃ。\n
　年のせいかのぉ‥‥\n
　さいきん　すっかり―ー\p

「ねむって　ばかりじゃ。\n
　じゃから、すこし　えいようを\n
　あたえてやっては　くれんか。\p

「‥‥おっと、それから\n
　えいようは〈ひる〉に\n
　あたえるようにな。\p

「たのんだぞ‥‥。\p
column6:
{My, my... It has been a long time since someone last needed my assistance.}\p

{A very long time indeed...}\p

{I do not mind sharing my knowledge with you, but would you mind doing me a favor first?}\p

{You see, there is another like me in the <Scorching Desert>... The <Old Tree of the North>.}\p

{However, he has not been talking to me at all recently. All he ever does is sleep...\n
Must be old age.}\p

{I would like you to give him some kind of pick-me-up, something that would give him some pep.}\p

{Oh, and make sure to do it at <noon>.}\p

{Thank you, little girl.}\p

column5:
「おぬし‥‥まだ\n
　ヤツを　おこしてないのか？\p

「はやく〈きた〉のヤツを\n
　おこすのじゃ！\n
　はるか〈ジリリ砂漠〉に―ー\p

「ヤツ‥‥〈きたの老木〉はいる。\n
　まひるに〈畑のひりょう〉を\n
　あたえるのじゃ！\p
column6:
{It seems he is still sleeping.}\p

{Hurry up and wake that old-timer!}\p

{Go to the <Scorching Desert> and give the <Old Tree of the North> some <Fertilizer> at <noon>!}\p

column5:
「―ーどうやら、やつとも\n
　はなせたようじゃの。\p

「それでは\n

「なぜ、月が\n
　なくなってしまったかをの‥‥。\p
column6:
{It appears you have managed to speak with him.}\p

{In that case, I will tell you my side of the story.}\p

{This is the reason the Moon has vanished from the heavens...}\p

column5:
〈みなみの老木〉\n
「この大陸のある星‥‥\n
　〈ちきう〉のまわりには―ー\p

「月が回っておった。\n
　月は、ワシら〈ちきう〉に―ー\p

「すむ者すべてに　やすらぎを\n
　あたえとった。\p

「それは月の女神\n
　〈セラヴィー〉のおかげじゃ。\p

「しかし‥‥月は　きえた。\n
　女神に　なにが　おこったのか？\n
　ワシには解らん。\p

「それからじゃの‥‥\n
　大陸に〈ジャマモノ〉どもが\n
　あふれだしたのも‥‥。\p

「人間たちは月が　なくとも\n
　なんとも　おもっちゃいない。\p

「月が　どれだけ\n
　人のこころに作用していたかなど\n
　まるで解っちゃおらん。\p

「いつしか人のこころに　ひそむ\n
　〈よこしまなキモチ〉は\n
　大きくなってしまった。\p

「人間は　ほかの生物と\n
　きょうぞんしてるということを\n
　わすれかけておる。\p

「〈ちきう〉は人間たちだけの\n
　ものではない、というのにの。\p

「―ーワシは月が　しんぱいじゃ。\n
　きっと月では\n
　なにかが　おこっとる。\p

「―ー[lulu]。\n
　おぬしは月に行き\n
　女神に　あうのじゃ。\p

「人間たちを‥‥そして\n
　〈ちきう〉を　これいじょう\n
　けがしては　ならん。\p

「―ーさ、いそぐのじゃ！\n
　おさなき月魔法使いよ!!\p
column6:
〈Old Tree of the South〉\n
{The Moon orbits around planet <Arth>...}\p

{That is to say, this very planet, where our continent resides.}\p

{The living creatures of <Arth> have always lived in peace and comfort thanks to the power of the Moon Goddes <Seravy>.}\p

{But now the Moon is gone...\n
Did something happen to the Goddess?\n
Not even I know the answer.}\p

{Ever since the Moon vanished, <monsters> have started running rampant.}\p

{However, humans do not seem to care about the Moon's disappearance.}\p

{They do not realize just how much influence it had on them.}\p

{Slowly and steadily, <wicked feelings> began to develop within their hearts.}\p

{Humanity has forgotten that it is supposed to coexist with other living creatures...}\p

{...That the <Arth> does not belong only to them.}\p

{I am terribly worried about the Moon.\n
Something must have happened there.}\p

{[lulu].\n
You must go to the Moon and see the Goddess.}\p

{Humanity―the <Arth>―has suffered enough.}\p

{Hurry, young Lunagician!}\p

column5:
「なにを　しとる！\n
　いそぐのじゃ!!\p

「月へは砂漠の中にある\n
　〈ポコペン塔〉から\n
　行くことが　できる。\p

「もし月から　この地に　もどり\n
　ふたたび月へ行きたい時は\n
　ワシに　あいにくるのじゃ!!\p
column6:
{What are you waiting for?!\n
You must hurry!}\p

{The way to the Moon lies within the <Holey Tower> in the desert.}\p

{If you come back to Arth and wish to return to the Moon, come talk to me!}\p

column7:
The Japanese is actually more like "being useful". Peter's dad was "useful", "helpful" to many, and Peter wants to be someone that can be as useful. Lulu doesn't think she can ever be "useful" to people, and Peter replies that she'll definitely be "useful" to people.
Using the term "useful" makes this conversation very weird, so I changed it to be about "people looking up to" them. It seems a better goal than being "useful". I should note that this also comes up in the ending, with the Goddess Seravy telling Lulu that she has definitely done a "service" to people (but I wrote that as her peers "will look up to her").

column7: NOTE: the in-game word wrapper knows how to handle hyphens, but the static one that checks for box overflow in advance does not, and adding it would violate a lot of assumptions i made when i wrote it. so for this one time where the difference actually matters and not hyphen-breaking would cause an overflow, i'm prebaking the line breaks just to shut it up.

「[lulu]‥‥。\n

　バサラのこころも―ー\p

「やがて　ひかりを\n
　とりもどすことでしょう。\p

「もう、あのころに\n
　もどれは　しないんやろか‥‥？\p
column6:
〈Vajra〉\n
{Oh, dear... I was wrong...\n
So very wrong...}\p

{I wish we could bring those times back...}\p

column5:
〈カカカ〉\n
「カ―ーッカッカッカッカッ！\n
　おまえ‥‥もう、おそいわい。\p

〈バサラ〉\n
「そうか‥‥。すまんなぁ。\n
　さいごまで　めいわく―ー\p

「かけてもうて‥‥。でも\n
　あんさんと　きえるんなら―ー\p

「それも　えぇやろ‥‥。\p
column6:
〈Vajra〉\n
{I'm sorry I had to trouble you until the very end...}\p

{But... I'm glad we can leave this world together...}\p

column5:
〈カカカ〉\n
「ほな、セキニンとろか‥‥。\p

「２人して　はなばなしく\n
　きえるんやで―ー!!\p
column6:
〈Cackleca〉\n
{And we'll leave it in a blaze of glory!\n
Here it comes...!}\p

column5:
〈バサラ〉\n
「あんさん‥‥[sweat]\p

〈セラヴィー〉\n
「―ーそこまでです。\n
　バサラ、カカカよ‥‥。\p

「なにも　きえる\n
　ひつようなど　ありません。\p
column6:
〈Seravy〉\n
{...That will not be necessary, Vajra, Cackleca.}\p

column5:
〈バサラ〉\n
「しかし、それでは‥‥！\p

〈カカカ〉\n
「―ー女神は、こんなワシらを\n
　ゆるしてくださるのか？\p
column6:
〈Cackleca〉\n
{Are you willing to forgive us, my Lady?}\p

column5:
〈セラヴィー〉\n
「ゆるすも　なにも\n
　あなたがた２人だけが―ー\p

「わるかったわけでは\n
　ないのですから―ー\p
column6:
〈Seravy〉\n
{There is nothing to be forgiven.}\p

{I have never once thought the two of you to have wronged me in any way.}\p

column5:
〈バサラ〉\n
「わ、わ、わ‥‥[sweat]\p

〈カカカ〉\n
「どしたん!?　おまえ‥‥？\p

〈バサラ〉\n
「な、なにかがカラダから\n
　はなれていったんや‥‥。\p

「なーんかスゥーっとして\n
　キモチえぇなぁ‥‥。\p
column6:
〈Vajra〉\n
{I felt something leave my body...}\p

{It's... It's amazing.\n
I feel so good now!}\p

column5:
〈[lulu]〉\n
「きゃっ!?\p

〈カカカ〉\n
「なんや!?\p

〈セラヴィー〉\n
「〈よこしまなキモチ〉です！\n
　バサラを動かしていた―ー\p

「わるいこころの集合体です！\n
　あれを　たおさないかぎり\n
　〈ちきう〉も月も―ー。\p
column6:
〈Seravy〉\n
{It is the <Wicked Feelings> that were controlling Vajra!}\p

{They must be purged, or neither the <Arth> nor the Moon will ever be safe!}\p

column5:
〈カカカ〉\n
「女神よ！\n
　―ーどうすれば!?\p
column6:
〈Cackleca〉\n
{Is there anything we can do, my Lady?!}\p

column5:
〈セラヴィー〉\n
「〈やさしいココロ〉を　もった\n
　月魔法使いの力なら―ー\p

「‥‥[lulu]に\n
　まかせるしかありません。\p
column6:
〈Seravy〉\n
{Only a Lunagician with a <Kind Heart> can truly defeat the <Wicked Feelings>...}\p

{We must have faith in [lulu].}\p

column5:
〈カカカ〉\n
「[lulu]――――――ーっ!!\p
column6:
〈Cackleca〉\n
{Then that's what we'll do!\n
You got this, [lulu]!!}\p

column5:
〈セラヴィー〉\n
『[lulu]‥‥。\p

〈[lulu]〉\n
「もぉう[anger]　こんなトコまで\n
　つれてきてぇ!!\p

「かくごして！　アンタなんか\n
　あたしの魔法１撃で\n
　たおしてやるんだから!!\p
column6:
〈[lulu]〉\n
{Grrr![nbsp][anger] Who asked you to bring me here, you big jerk?!}\p

{You wanna fight me, is that it? You're on!\n
Let's see how you like my magic!!}\p

column5:
〈[lulu]〉\n
『あたし、こんなヤツなんかに\n
　ゼッタイまけない‥‥！\p

『コワくて　なきそうだけど\n
　‥‥ゼッタイに　まけない!!\p

『―ーおじいちゃん、ペーター\n
　あたしを‥‥\n
　あたしをみまもっていて‥‥！\p
column6:
〈[lulu]〉\n
(I can tell... I [em]have[/em] to defeat this thing.)\p

(This is so scary I want to cry, but...\n
I [em]have[/em] to do this.)\p

(Gramps... Peter...\n
Please watch over me...!)\p

column5:
〈よこしまなキモチ〉\n
「ム――――――――――ーン!!\p

〈[lulu]〉\n
『‥‥やった!?\n
　あたし、やったの‥‥？\p

『―ーでも、あんなのが\n
　〈よこしまなキモチ〉だった\n
　なんて‥‥。\p
column6:
〈[lulu]〉\n
(I... I did it?\n
Did I actually win?)\p

(So those were <Wicked Feelings>...)\p

column5:
〈セラヴィー〉\n
「[lulu]‥‥。\n
　よく、がんばりましたね。\p

〈[lulu]〉\n
「女神様‥‥!!\p

〈セラヴィー〉\n
「―ーさぁ、[lulu]。\n
　ここはキケンです。\p

〈セラヴィー〉\n
「はやく\n
　ここをでましょう。\p
column6:
〈Seravy〉\n
{This place is too dangerous, [lulu].\n
We must leave at once.}\p

column5:
〈[lulu]〉\n
「―ー女神様‥‥。\n
　人間のワルいココロは―ー\p

「あんなものまで\n
　作りだしちゃうんだね‥‥。\n
　けっきょく、ワルいのは―ー\p

「あたしたち\n
　人間だったんだね‥‥。\p
column6:
〈[lulu]〉\n
{That monster was born from the evil in humans' hearts, wasn't it...?}\p

{In the end, it was all our fault...}\p

column5:
〈セラヴィー〉\n
「‥‥そうかもしれません。\n
　しかし、それをおさえる―ー\p

「良いココロも、あなたたち\n
　人間は　もっています。\p

「そのココロを\n
　なくさないかぎり\n
　〈よこしまなキモチ〉に―ー\p

「まけることは\n
　ぜったいに　ありません。\p

「あなたの　そのやさしさがあれば\n
　人間のワルいココロを\n
　うるおすことができるでしょう。\p

「―ー[lulu]。\n
　あなたは人のやくに\n
　たつことをしたんですよ。\p
column6:
〈Seravy〉\n
{...It is true that those <Wicked Feelings> are born from humans' hearts...}\p

{But those same hearts also have the power to drive them away.}\p

{Thanks to people like you, humanity will never give in to those <Wicked Feelings>.}\p

{Your kindness is an example to all, [lulu].\n
Your peers will look up to you.}\p

column5:
〈[lulu]〉\n
「あたしが\n
　人のやくに‥‥？\p

〈セラヴィー〉\n
「そうです。だから気を\n
　おとさないで‥‥。\p

「さぁ、もとの世界へ\n
　かえりましょう。\n
　あなたの　かえりを―ー\p

「たくさんの人が\n
　まっていますよ。\p
column6:
〈Seravy〉\n
{Surely. So do not lose spirit, child.}\p

{Now let us leave.\n
There are many who await your return.}\p

column5:
〈[lulu]〉\n
「はい！\n
　女神様‥‥!!\p

〈バサラ〉\n
「アタイが‥‥アタイが\n
　まちがってたんやな‥‥。\p

「こんな〈おいぼれ〉が\n
　ひかりの世界をあやつろうなどと\n
　おもわなければよいものを‥‥。\p

「女神様！\n
　アタイは、どう　つみを\n
　つぐなえばいいんやろか？\p

「なにを\n
　わびたら良いのかの‥‥。\p
column6:
〈Vajra〉\n
{This is all my fault...}\p

{How could I do this to you? To everyone?}\p

{How may I atone for my sins, my Goddess?}\p

{I'll do anything...}\p

column5:
〈セラヴィー〉\n
「‥‥バサラよ。\n
　ふかくかんがえることは―ー\p

「ありません。\n
　あなたは　いままでどおり―ー\p

「わたしのもとで\n
　ポムたちの\n
　せわをするのです。\p

「―ーわたしは、あなたを\n
　いましめようなどと\n
　おもってはないのですから‥‥。\p
column6:
〈Seravy〉\n
{...As I have said, there is nothing to be forgiven, Vajra.}\p

{If you feel you must do something, then I want you to keep helping the Poms as you have always done.}\p

column5:
〈バサラ〉\n
「―ー！\n
　うっ、うっ、女神様‥‥[sweat]\p

〈[lulu]〉\n
「バサラ‥‥。\p

〈カカカ〉\n
「ようやっと、解ったようや。\n
　これでアヤツも―ー\p

「ふたたび、こんなことを\n
　しようなどとと\n
　おもわんやろ。\p
column6:
〈Cackleca〉\n
{Well, I don't think she's gonna do anythin' like that again. She's a big softie, see?}\p

column5:
〈[lulu]〉\n
「‥‥うん。\p

〈バサラ〉\n
「ヒェ―ーッ、ヒェッ、ヒェッ!!\p

「ぶじに月に　これたぐらいで\n
　あんしんして\n
　もらっちゃあ　こまるね!!\p

「ムダだよ！　ムスメっ子!!\n
　その　ていどの魔力で\n
　アタイに　かてるモンかい!!\p

「―ーそれにしても‥‥。\n
　あのドクロじじぃ！\n
　よくもどって　これたもんだね！\p

「ケッ！　まぁいいさ。\n
　２人まとめて\n
　めんどうみてやるとも!!\p

「ヒェ―ーッ、ヒェッ、ヒェッ!!\n
　ヒェッ、ヒェッ!!\p

「ヒェ―ーッ‥‥ゴホッ、ゴホッ!!\n
　ゴホッ、ゴホッ!!\p

「ゴッホ、ゴホッ!!\n
　―ーあ〜、しんど‥‥[sweat]\p
column6:
〈Vajra〉\n
{Hee hee hee!}\p

{Did you think you'd be on easy street just because you've made it to the Moon?}\p

{Give it up, brat!\n
You'll never beat me with your pathetic magic!}\p

{With that said... I'm surprised that old skull managed to make it back...}\p

{Bah, it doesn't matter.\n
I'll take care of both of you very soon!}\p

{Hee hee hee...\n
Hee hee hee!}\p

{HEE HEE HEE―\n
*cough*!\n
*cough* *cough*!!}\p

{*cough*...\n
Note to self: less evil laughing...[nbsp][sweat]}\p

column5:
〈[lulu]〉\n
「うわぁ―ーっ！\n
　〈災害〉だ〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜!!\p

「はやく〈サイジャマ〉を\n
　やっつけないと\n
　建物こわされちゃう〜〜〜〜〜!!\p
column6:
〈[lulu]〉\n
{Oh no! It's a <disaster>!}\p

{I have to get rid of the <Dismonsters> before they break my buildings!}\p
column9:
〈[lulu]〉\n
{うわぁ―ーっ！\n
　〈災害〉だ〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜!!}\p

{はやく〈サイジャマ〉を\n
　やっつけないと\n
　建物こわされちゃう〜〜〜〜〜!!}\p

〈[lulu]〉\n
「うわぁ―ーっ！\n
　〈災害〉だ〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜!!\p

　やっつけないと\n
　建物こわされちゃう〜〜〜〜〜!!\p

　やっつけないと\n

〈[lulu]〉\n
{Oh no! It's a <disaster>!}\p

{I have to get rid of the <Dismonsters> before they break my buildings!}\p

column5:
〈[lulu]〉\n
「えっ！\n
　〈ムム〉なの!?\p

「いや〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜っ[sweat]\n
　やめて〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜っ!!\n
　こわさないで〜〜〜〜〜〜〜っ[anger]\p
column9:
〈[lulu]〉\n
{えっ！\n
　〈ムム〉なの!?}\p

{いや〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜っ[sweat]\n
　やめて〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜〜っ!!\n
　こわさないで〜〜〜〜〜〜〜っ[anger]}\p

〈ほうこく書〉\n
\n

column5:
ポムが町をうろついて\n
こまっとる。\n
ポムたちに〈家〉を\n
つくらせてないんじゃないか？\n
それでは町の者も、\n
おまえをあいてに　しなくなるぞ！\n
column6:
It would be trouble if the Poms wandered inside the village.\n
Why don't you have them build themselves a <house>?\n
That way the villagers will have no complaints!\n
column9:
ポムが町をうろついて\n
こまっとる。\n
ポムたちに〈家〉を\n
つくらせてないんじゃないか？\n
それでは町の者も、\n
おまえをあいてに　しなくなるぞ！\n

column5:
ポムが店の食物をぬすんで、\n
食いちらかしとるらしいの。\n
ひょっとして、ポムたちはハラを\n
すかしているのじゃないか？\n
店の者を　おこらすまえに、\n
ポムたちに〈畑〉を\n
つくらせることじゃ。\n
column6:
It seems the Poms have been stealing food from the village shop.\n
Could it be that your Poms are starving?\n
Before you anger the shopkeeper, you shold have the Poms make a <Field>.\n
column9:
ポムが店の食物をぬすんで、\n
食いちらかしとるらしいの。\n
ひょっとして、ポムたちはハラを\n
すかしているのじゃないか？\n
店の者を　おこらすまえに、\n
ポムたちに〈畑〉を\n
つくらせることじゃ。\n

column5:
〈畑〉になった〈えさ〉は\n
はやく〈しゅうかく〉しないと\n
くさって、なくなってしまうぞえ。\n
column6: <Food> grown on the <Field> will go bad if you don't <harvest> it soon.\n
column9:
〈畑〉になった〈えさ〉は\n
はやく〈しゅうかく〉しないと\n
くさって、なくなってしまうぞえ。\n

column5:
<Meymey>にも、\n
きちんと〈えさ〉を　あたえないと\n
いかんぞ！\n
〈メェメェフード〉を買って、\n
食べさせれば<Meymey>も\n
よろこぶじゃろ。\n
column6:
<Meymeys> should be <fed> properly as well!\n
Give them some <Meymey Food>. You'll make them very happy.\n
column9:
〈メェメェ〉にも、\n
きちんと〈えさ〉を　あたえないと\n
いかんぞ！\n
〈メェメェフード〉を買って、\n
食べさせれば〈メェメェ〉も\n
よろこぶじゃろ。\n

column5:
ポムたちは　げんきで\n
やっとるか？\n
わしには　すこし　げんきが\n
ないように　みえるんぢゃが、\n
気のせいぢゃろか‥‥。\n
ポムたちに〈病院〉でも\n
作らせてみては　どうかの。\n
column6:
How are the Poms doing?\n
They don't seem to be doing so well... I hope it's just my imagination.\n
To be safe, you should have them build a <Hospital>.\n
column9:
ポムたちは　げんきで\n
やっとるか？\n
わしには　すこし　げんきが\n
ないように　みえるんぢゃが、\n
気のせいぢゃろか‥‥。\n
ポムたちに〈病院〉でも\n
作らせてみては　どうかの。\n

column5:
ポムたちは〈良い子〉にしとるか？\n
もし、ワルイ子になって、\n
こまることがあるようなら、\n
〈教会〉でも\n
作らせてみることぢゃ。\n
column6:
Are the Poms behaving?\n
We don't want them to start acting bad.\n
I think a <Church> would help.\n

why would it help? does the Community Church lower Pom karma?
column9:

もし、ワルイ子になって、\n
こまることがあるようなら、\n

作らせてみることぢゃ。\n

column5:
ポムが町の〈教会〉でイタズラを\n
すると神父が　おこっとるぞ！\n
きちんと〈じょうしき〉のあるポム\n
に育てているか？\n
〈図書館〉でも建てて、\n
ポムの〈ＩＱ〉を上げることぢゃ！\n
column6:
It seems the Poms have been playing pranks at the village's <Church>!\n
Have you been teaching them proper manners?\n
You should have them build a <Library> and raise their <IQ>!\n

column5:
ポムたちは　げんきでやっとるか？\n
〈井戸〉でもあれば、\n
ポムはもっと　げんきになるぞ！\n
column6:
How are the Poms doing?\n
They'd feel much better if they had a <Well>!\n
column9:
ポムたちは　げんきでやっとるか？\n
〈井戸〉でもあれば、\n

column5:
大食らいのポムに　しょうしょう\n
こまっとるようぢゃの。\n
そういうときは〈食料庫〉を\n
作らせるのぢゃ。\n
〈食料庫〉があれば、\n
たくさんの〈えさ〉を　ほぞんしておくことができるからの！\n
column6:
It seems the Poms' bottomless stomach is giving you trouble.\n
You should have them build a <Pantry>.\n
That way you can store a lot of food for them!\n
column9:
大食らいのポムに　しょうしょう\n
こまっとるようぢゃの。\n
そういうときは〈食料庫〉を\n
作らせるのぢゃ。\n
〈食料庫〉があれば、\n
たくさんの〈えさ〉を　ほぞんしておくことができるからの！\n

column5:
ポムたちは　そうとう\n
ここが気に　いったらしいの。\n
ポムたちに好きなものを\n
作らせてやるがいい。\n

column9:

column5:

あらたな　はっけんが\n

You should have Poms <study> once in a while.\n
Who knows, they might discover something new!\n
